segments.key_quote: It is irrefutable that Srila Prabhupada appointed gurus or diksha gurus or acharyas. He only appointed officiating acharyas or rithwiks.
segments.summary: The speaker argues that even if there was confusion in the reply to question 4, the reply to question 3 was clear: they would be rithwiks, not diksha gurus, and that Srila Prabhupada's signature was essential on the minutes.
segments.transcript: Anyway, hypothetically speaking, for the sake of argument, let us say that Srila Prabhupada's reply to question 4 was not clear. Whether the disciples belong to Srila Prabhupada or they become disciples, it is not clear. So, no matter whatever the lack of clarity in the reply to question 4, the reply to question 3, there was never any doubt. It was crystal clear and it was accepted to be so by all the GBC members present there. What was that? That they would be rithwiks and not diksha gurus. None of them had any question. So, it is irrefutable that Srila Prabhupada appointed gurus or diksha gurus or acharyas. He only appointed officiating acharyas or rithwiks. Now, the hypothetical confusion is with regard to only question 4. And what is that question 4? The question 4 is what is the relationship between the rithwik and the person getting diksha or initiation. This is where confusion hypothetically is. It is shown that there is no confusion. Even if such confusion is there, all such confusion was completely cleared by Srila Prabhupada when he chose the first 11 rithwiks through his directive on July 9, 1977. In that directive, Srila Prabhupada not only appointed 11 rithwiks but he also made it amply clear there what is the relationship between the rithwik and the disciple. So, that confusion about the relationship between the rithwik and the disciple was also cleared by Srila Prabhupada on July 9. So, what remains? However, despite the so-called confusion in the response to question 4, here is what the rithwik recorded. Srila Prabhupada said he will appoint several devotees who shall perform initiation in the future even after his disappearance. The disciples they accept shall be their disciples and Srila Prabhupada will be their grand spiritual master. Actually, this is not what Prabhupada said. Anyway, this is what they recorded in the minutes book. The seven members came back and whatever they said got entered into the minutes book. And all the 18 members present there signed the minutes. But, they did not take Srila Prabhupada's signature on the minutes. That was a grave omission. After all, all the devotees in all fairness, in an ideal case, Srila Prabhupada's signature was essential on the minutes. But, they did not take it. Devotees, in fact, did try to take Srila Prabhupada's signature on that minutes. But, see for yourself what happened. This is what happened. He states, Jyadvaita Maharaj did say strongly that I had better get this in writing from Srila Prabhupada. He said this was very important and that it was really not clear. He said that unless it was in writing, it would be contested by devotees later. I was not clear to me. But, Jyadvaita Maharaj insisted that I get it in writing from Prabhupada.

segments.key_quote: Tamalkrishna Goswami stalled, obstructed the demand to get Srila Prabhupada's signature on the GBC minutes.
segments.summary: The speaker describes how Tamalkrishna Goswami prevented Srila Prabhupada from signing the GBC minutes and emphasizes that the July 9, 1977 Directive is the clear instruction.
segments.transcript: So, on his advice, I thought he must be right that it was very serious. I went down to Tamalkrishna Maharaj and asked about it. I asked Tamalkrishna Maharaj to please understand that Prabhupada picked the regular gurus when he named the persons who would initiate while he was still with us. Tamalkrishna Maharaj replied that he himself knew very well what Prabhupada intended and that was good enough for him. So, he continues, I tried again to ask him, to ask Prabhupada to sign something, but Tamalkrishna was not willing. So, you see, Tamalkrishna Goswami stalled, obstructed the demand to get Srila Prabhupada's signature on the GBC minutes. Maybe he knew what would happen if they did that. Srila Prabhupada gave clear directions in the July 9, 1977 Directive. Those instructions are unequivocal. We cannot go by what the GBC recorded in the minutes book because it is not countersigned by Srila Prabhupada. Again, for hypothetical argument's sake, if we assume that Srila Prabhupada did indeed want his signature as it was recorded in the minutes of the GBC in writing, one thing is very very clear. The GBC recorded in their minutes that Srila Prabhupada will appoint devotees who shall perform initiations in the future. This is what that recording says. But, did that appointment come from Srila Prabhupada or their grand disciples of Srila Prabhupada? Fact is that the appointment of gurus never came from Srila Prabhupada. Hence, there is no basis for the guru system which was implemented in ISKCON in 1978 nor the one which is currently running. Both are only rubber stamped in 1977 for rittviks not for gurus not for diksha gurus. And in that directive, very clearly it is mentioned that the disciples will be Srila Prabhupada's disciples not the rittviks.

segments.key_quote: The newly initiated devotees are disciples of His Divine Grace who receives a letter from these representatives giving the spiritual name or the thread.
segments.summary: The speaker reads the July 9, 1977 Directive, highlighting that the newly initiated devotees are disciples of Srila Prabhupada.
segments.transcript: And here is that directive. So, this directive was written to all GBC and temple members and it is approved by Srila Prabhupada with his signature on this letter. So, this letter begins Dear Maharajs and Prabhus, please accept my humble obeisances at your feet. Recently, when all of the GBC members were with His Divine Grace in Vrindavan, Srila Prabhupada indicated that soon he would have the purpose of performing initiations, both first initiation and second initiation. His Divine Grace has so far given a list of eleven disciples who will act in that capacity. And then the list of the eleven names was written down in the letter. These were the eleven names. And the letter continues. In the past, temple presidents have returned to Srila Prabhupada recommending the first and second initiation to whichever of these eleven representatives are nearest their temple. After considering the recommendation, these representatives may accept the devotee as an initiated disciple of Srila Prabhupada by giving a spiritual name or in the case of second initiation by chanting on the Gayatri thread just as Srila Prabhupada has done. The newly initiated devotees are disciples of His Divine Grace who receives a letter from these representatives giving the spiritual name or the thread. He can perform the fire ajna in the temple as was being done before. The Devotee who is a devotee of Srila Prabhupada is a disciple of Srila Prabhupada and approved by Srila Prabhupada himself with his trademark signature.

segments.key_quote: Prabhupada is not well. Besides, I think he is busy. Let's not disturb him with this.
segments.summary: The speaker shares an interaction that happened on the Krishna Balram temple courtyard.
segments.transcript: So, in four places in the temple in his diary of late July 1977, he has recorded an interaction which happened on the Krishna Balram temple courtyard. Guru Kripa to Bhagawan Why don't we go and ask Lord Krishna? Let's go and see Prabhupada and clarify this Hrithik Acharya thing. Tamal Krishna to Guru Kripa. Prabhupada is not well. Besides, I think he is busy. Let's not disturb him with this. Let's see the next few days, who also recollect about this Hrithik incident. One of them is Gouridas Pandit Prabhu who recalls in On My Behalf. So Gouridas Pandit next morning, July 8th, if there should be Vyasasans for the Ritwiks in the temples. So July 7th was a conversation where Prabhupada gave all the names, which finally appeared on the July 9th directive. But on the intervening day on July 8th, Tamalkrishna Goswami had further questions to ask, so that when he finally made the July 9th letter, all these things could go in. So, on July 9th, he asked them in the next morning, on July 8th, if there should be Vyasasans for the Ritwiks in the temple. Srila Prabhupada said, no, that would create enmity amongst my disciples. Tamalkrishna Goswami also asked Srila Prabhupada if there could be more Ritwiks in the future. Srila Prabhupada said that more could be appointed by the GBC at Mayapur. Tamalkrishna Goswami asked Srila Prabhupada what to do if a Ritwik falls down and Srila Prabhupada replied that, the GBC could remove them. I told some of the devotees what I heard about this and Yashodha Nandan wrote it down in his diary. So, actually, you see, appointment or removal of the Ritwiks is not a major issue. Because if we need more Ritwiks, how will we decide we need more Ritwiks? It is when there are too many devotees to be initiated and whatever number of Ritwiks we have now, it is not sufficing. So, you increase the number of Ritwiks. It is purely based on demand. And when you have to manage demand and supply, it is called management. And the GBC is a managerial body. It will manage appointment as well as removal of the Ritwiks. And that's why Prabhupada's July 9th directive did not talk about appointing or removal of the Ritwiks because the GBCs could do it.

segments.key_quote: Tamalkrishna Maharaj was talking about the Ritwik gurus to initiate on behalf of Prabhupada after he leaves the planet.
segments.summary: The speaker shares an interaction that happened on the Krishna Balram temple courtyard.
segments.transcript: Then Gauridas Pandit Prabhu continues. On July 8th, Yashodha Nandan Prabhu wrote in his diary, Tamalkrishna Maharaj was talking about the Ritwik gurus to initiate on behalf of Prabhupada after he leaves the planet. And on July 9th, Yashodha Nandan Prabhu wrote in his diary. I heard from Tamalkrishna Maharaj in the afternoon, that Sri Prabhupada had told him to send a letter to all temples to explain the Ritwik system for the future. The next day, on 10th of July, Yashodha Nandan Prabhu wrote in his diary, Tamalkrishna Maharaj had written on behalf of Sri Prabhupada to issue a letter to all the temples to explain the Ritwik system for the future. Tamal Krishna Maharaj comes out of Prabhupada's room and the conversation goes like this. Tamal Krishna Maharaj, Haribol, Yesodha, did you see this? Yesodha, no, what is it? Tamal Krishna Goswami. This is signed by Prabhupada. Yesodha Nandan Prabhu, what does all this mean? Tamal Krishna Goswami. Devotees have been writing to Prabhupada asking for initiations and now Prabhupada has named 11 Ritwiks who can initiate on his behalf. Prabhupada said, others can be added. Yesodha Nandan Prabhu. And when Prabhupada disappears, Tamal Krishna Goswami, they will be Ritwiks. That is what Prabhupada said. It is all on tape. And this is what Gauridas Pandit Prabhu has recorded in his On My Behalf. So you see, Tamal Krishna Goswami said, devotees have been writing to Prabhupada asking for initiations. So actually what had happened, after the May 28th conversation, it was clear to everyone. That Prabhupada was going to appoint Ritwiks. So all the initiations were put on hold. And by July 7th, lot of requests had become pending. And that is how Tamal Krishna Maharaj went and asked Prabhupada, what to do now? May 28th, already Prabhupada had said that he is going to appoint some Ritwiks, but that had not happened. And they did not know what to do now. They were waiting. So Prabhupada then, on July 7th, gave the names for the Ritwiks. So when Tamal Krishna Maharaj said, got it, he told Yashodha Nandan Prabhu, devotees have been writing to Prabhupada asking for initiations and now Prabhupada has named 11 Ritwiks who can initiate on his behalf. And Prabhupada said, others can be added. By whom? Naturally by the GBC. In another testimony by His Holiness Chyavana Swami on his Facebook page on September 7th, 2016, he gave a testimony. According to his testimony, Srila Prabhupada said, I will continue to accept this. I will have millions of disciples and give them my blessings. Even after I am no longer physically present, you may initiate them on my behalf.

segments.key_quote: The fact of the matter was, Srila Prabhupada made himself very clear on how new devotees coming into his movement were to be accepted into it after his disappearance.
segments.summary: The speaker shares an interaction that happened on the Krishna Balram temple courtyard.
segments.transcript: To that, Prabhupada added, I will have millions of disciples. This is what Chyavana Swami recalls. Yet another devotee from Srila Prabhupada coined the term Ritwik, which was an article on Vaishnava News Network on December 1st, 1998. One devotee, Pitha Prabhu, recollected in 1998, The fact of the matter was, Srila Prabhupada made himself very clear on how new devotees coming into his movement were to be accepted into it after his disappearance. The word Ritwik was first heard by me from Srila Prabhupada's lotus mouth and His Divine Grace used the term many times during his last two weeks in Vandavan. I remember this clearly. Because I didn't know what a Ritwik was. This is Pitha Prabhu. Another devotee, Lochanananda Prabhu, in his book, Srila Prabhupada's Hidden Glories, he writes, One other thing Pitha Prabhu mentioned in the same letter to Lochanananda Prabhu was that he heard Srila Prabhupada say at least a dozen times in Vandavan in 1977 that initiation should be performed after his departure. by the Ritwik Acharya. So, you can see there are multiple devotees who recollect Prabhupada saying that the future initiations, even after his disappearance, would continue to be done by the Ritwiks. Now, let us see what a third party, a person not connected to ISKCON, had to say on this appointment. This is B. V. Puri Maharaj from Sri Chaitanya Chandra Ashram. This is B. V. Puri Maharaj from Sri Chaitanya Chandra Ashram. This is B. V. Puri Maharaj from Sri Chaitanya Chandra Ashram. He recollects a conversation with Srila Prabhupada that he had in late 1977. B. V. Puri Maharaj, Maharaj, you have established 11 Gurus. There is no harmony. There can be no harmony. Guru must be one. You have selected 11 Gurus. Srila Prabhupada, I have not selected. I have appointed 11 Ritwiks. So, even someone outside of ISKCON was very clear and certain.

segments.key_quote: Hence, the July 9th directive to carry out initiations in ISKCON is not some temporary order. It is the final order of Srila Prabhupada and ISKCON must follow it.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing the crucial significance of the May 28th meeting and the July 9th directive, stating that the Rithvik system of initiation is the final order of Srila Prabhupada.
segments.transcript: That Srila Prabhupada appointed Ritwiks, not Gurus. And as we have seen the events leading up to the May 28th meeting of the GBC, it was of very crucial significance. Srila Prabhupada had decided to leave the world and came to Vrindavan for that very purpose. And there he called the GBC to Vrindavan to discuss what directions they wanted for the future of the movement after his departure. It was in that context that the May 28th meeting took place. It was in that context that the May 28th meeting took place. It was in that context that the May 28th meeting took place. And the July 9th directive was an outcome of that meeting as it is mentioned in the opening lines of the directive. Recently, when all of the GBC members were there with his divine grace in Vrindavan, Srila Prabhupada indicated that soon he would appoint some of his senior disciples to act as Ritwik representative of the Acharya for the purpose of performing his duties. Srila Prabhupada indicated that soon he would appoint some of his senior disciples to act as Ritwik representative of the Acharya for the purpose of performing his duties. initiation. This is the opening line of the July 9th directive. So, this opening line refers to the recent meeting of the GBC with Srila Prabhupada. So, it is clear that this Rithvik system of initiation was particularly for the time when Srila Prabhupada was no longer with us, because that GBC meeting with Srila Prabhupada referred to in the opening line of this July 9th directive is referring to the May 28th GBC meeting. Hence, the July 9th directive to carry out initiations in ISKCON is not some temporary order. It is the final order of Srila Prabhupada and ISKCON must follow it. Vishwaguru Srila Prabhupada ki jai.
